result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order to Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr. November 2, 2022
Initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:41 AM; Case called for Initial appearance. Defendant Paris L Smith Carr appeared by Zoom video, in custody at Walworth Co. Jail.  Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Redetzke in court as a friend of the Court on behalf of the defendant. Atty. Redetzke advises he believes the defendant will qualify for PD attorney and he should be appointed in this matter.  Atty. Thompson is asking that the initial appearance in this matter be addressed today.  Atty. Redetzke is asking that the court adjourn the initial appearance and address that, as well as a waiver of prelim, at the next court date.  Atty. Thompson has concerns about not setting bail in this matter.  Court confirms the defendant is still sitting on cash bail, which has not been posted, in her other 2 cases.  Court will adjourn for Initial appearance.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Defendant to appear by Zoom video from Walworth Co. Jail for the next court date.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Paris L Smith Carr

Prior: 2937 Coho St, Madison, WI 53713
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
